column4: hi all i'm having trouble setting up my second ethernet card. First card (eth0) set using wicd connects fine, browsing internet through that. I have another card which I like yo use for crossover cable for file transfer but I can't set it up. I tried statically in interfaces and also tried using wicd. What are suggestions.
pinging my laptop which is connected gives: ping: sendmsg: Operation not permitted
why does the network have to be so complicated in these new versions of Ubuntj?
I have 4 ethernet adapters in my ubuntu machine.. and they all work great
of course not.. that would be silly.
Im not sure what you would call 'manually'... ubuntu server has a slightly different (ie, no UI) way to configure things.
I Just brought up my eth1 "manually" and am reconfiguring my wireless router just fine :~).
and while your at it.. your routing table (route)
not sure dude.. your conf looks good
yes I know. Maybe I will <shudder> restart
